data.description:
This watch face emulates a Nixie tube watch display. Nixie tubes are neon tube digit displays used before LEDs were invented. Show 'em that you're really an old school alpha-geek like the Woz!

The display is dead simple: it shows the time (12 or 24 hour) in 4 big Nixie tube digits.

latest_release.release_notes: Improved images for 5 and 9 to make them distinct from 2 and 6 and recognizable even if watch viewed upside down.

Ver 1.2 updated : Support 24h format. (2016.1.9)
Very simple design analogue watchface.This watchface shows current time (Analogue and digital),month,date,weekday,battery level and Bluetooth indicator. If Bluetooth connection-loss from smartphone, then vibrate Pebble. It will help prevent misplacement of the smartphone.

data.author: smognus

changelog.release_notes: I think I uploaded a bad binary on the 1.7 release.  Was crashing.

- Cleaned up the face hour/tick marks.
- Added a "light" theme.
- Added configuration options for the second hand color.
Fixed an issue where all selected colors were saving for the same destination.
Increased the width of the digital time window to allow for 12 hour displays to include AM/PM.
Fixed configuration URL.  Oops...

Added a configuration option to display digital time.
Added configuration options for day & digital time display windows.
App was still calculating second hand components, even when the second hand layer was invisible.  This causes the battery life to be impacted more than it should be when that layer is hidden.
Made the second hand schedules actually... you know... work.
Initial release.

data.description:
It has always bothered me that watch hands on a rectangular watchface are a varying distance from the edge of the face.

This watchface grows and shrinks the hands dynamically so that they are always the same distance from the edge of the face.  In the case of the minute and second hands, they reach all the way to the edge.  The hour hand grows and shrinks to keep a constant 35 pixels from the edge of the screen.

There are several configuration options:
- Whether or not the second hand is drawn.
- Start and end hours for the second hand to be drawn.
- Colors for the second hand.
- Whether a battery status indicator is drawn.
- Whether a date window is drawn.
- Whether the digital time is drawn.
- Colors of the day/digital time windows.
- Dark and light themes.

I will also be looking at options to keep the date window from being obstructed by the minute and hour hands.

latest_release.release_notes: I think I uploaded a bad binary on the 1.7 release.  Was crashing.

data.title: Variable Hands

data.author: GrakovNe

changelog.release_notes: fixed month naming in Russian
- fixed wrong month
small fix
- fixed DD MMM in date style

Added:
 - Customizable night mode
 - Full charged picture
 - Celsium / Fahrenheit degrees for weather
 - Custom text in Info-string can be written
 - Special arrow when data is received
 - Special arrow when data wasn't receiver
 - Update info and weather by shake
 - Two types of time font size
 - Two types for data style
Fixed:
 - Stability
 - Repeating hourly vibrations

Changed:
- Reduced file size
- Reducing the amount of data transmitted by BT
- Reducing the refresh rate
- Reducing the frequency of calls to the EEPROM memory clock
- Automatic update of weather / info when reconnecting the phone hours
- Fixed a bug when you select a city with a long name
- Fix display "No network" on-line weather site, when it has to go into hiding
- Weather and info are stored in EEPROM and are called out at the start of the clock: no blank screen when you run the Feis
- Excluded forced update the battery every half hour: fixed the subscription service
- Slightly increased the font of hours, the next version will be able to make it even more
- Optimized * .c and * .js code

Added:
- Localization allowed now (ENG/RUS)
- Interactive BT icon
- Persist storage for settings on a watch
- Window colors can be inversed (Adjustable)
- Weather can be hidden (Adjustable)
- "Location" item in Additional string (no web)
- Vibration when charging cable is connected or disconnected
- Text in up bar can be hidden

Added:
 - Additional text String
Fixed:
 - Data refreshing loop when unconfigured
 - Layout has been finalized
 - Decrease power consumption [Message size]
 - No "Updating..." when weather refreshing

Bleeep beeep bop bebleep beep beebop ! Here is your favorite StarWars robot !
Shake it & give love to R2D2 !!  (and take a look at BB8's FACE too !)
--
-- Colors -- Chooses the best ! 
You prefer black ? Blue ? Orange ? Plain background ? As you wish.
--
-- Weather -- Enable or disable it. 
Shake your wrist to update it, Celcius or Farenheit, API key, City or GPS ?... ENJOY !
--
-- Battery -- Enable or disable it. 
Look at the line between date and time ! Big ? It's ok ! Tiny ? Find an outlet !
--
-- Bluetooth -- Enable or disable it. You see the green (or red ??) round ?? Here is it ! 
-- 
-- Vibes --  Every Hour ? (if you want).
-- 
-- 
[FR] Watchface configurable : couleurs, météo, bluetooth, batterie et vibrations...
Une idée ? Une envie particulière, envoyez moi un mail !

data.author: Ken Pettit

changelog.release_notes:
Initial release of RUNE.

Includes multiple operating modes and a tutorial that can be launched from the configuration page.

data.description:
RUNE watch conjures up a mystic time telling experience.

Time is told using four numbers shown in a triangular arrangement.  The hours are read across while the minutes are read downwards.  In "Physical" display mode, Rune's numbers are easily recognizable.  Rune also features a "Mystical" time telling mode which resembles the ancient rune symbols even more and easily perceptible with a little practice.

Times display on the screenshots:

20:28
08:13
10:49
(Rune symbols)

In addition to telling the time, Rune has features for showing the date, battery status and current weather conditions.  It also has three operating modes, including one which allows constant display of actual ancient runes (with the time available on "tap") and another "Oracle" mode to help answer those tough "Yes, No, Maybe" questions.

The Rune watch face for Pebble is modeled after the Rune Watch designed by Justin Schofield of the UK and published with his permission.  In fact, some of the text in this description is also Justin's work.

Marketing Banner credits to Justin Schofield (with edits and screenshot updates by Ken Pettit).

latest_release.release_notes:
Initial release of RUNE.

Includes multiple operating modes and a tutorial that can be launched from the configuration page.

data.author: AirieFenix

changelog.release_notes:
V1.1:

First release version, with little bugs correction and support for original Pebble and Pebble Time.

data.description:
Colours and explosions are great! However, we get tired very often of those. And they don't suit up very well with ties.

Minimal One is a simple minimalistic watchface that shows you the information that matters at a glance. It buzzes every o'clock time.

Time, current day and date are there. Simple, minimal. Quick! 

Supported by: Pebble, Pebble Steel, Pebble Time and Time Steel. Time Round coming soon!

--New--
-Added support for 12/24hs settings.

--- Next updates ---
- Choose the colours of the text.
- Choose formatting options for dates (dd/mm, mm/dd, day/dd, etc.).
- Switchable o'clock buzz on/off. 
- Choose an optional second time-zone.
- Time Round support.

This is my very first watchface, be sure I'll continue updating it. The previous new features are already in pipeline.
I'm on Twitter and email, feedback is much appreciated.

latest_release.release_notes:
V1.1:

First release version, with little bugs correction and support for original Pebble and Pebble Time.

Inspired by Pebble's Sliding Text watchface with added weather and date lines.

- Select background, hour, minute, and weather/date colors
- Left/Center/Right alignment options for display lines
- Select how often OpenWeatherMap.org weather information is updated
- Retrieve weather information using GPS or by manually entering location
- Option to display today's lo - hi temperatures (+last weather update time)
- Choose to display/hide date information
- Vibrate on Bluetooth disconnect option
- Readability options for weather/date and time display lines

If you're enjoying the SLIDING TIME WEATHER watchface, please click the heart above. You may also send feedback using the Support link below.

data.description:
A watchface that displays the local sidereal time! Sidereal time is used by astronomers to determine the positions of the stars in the sky at the current time. A sidereal day is four minutes shorter than a solar (normal) day, meaning that it's difficult to convert between the two time scales. This Pebble app takes care of all of that for you! 

It even automatically sets your time zone information and longitude to ensure the most accurate possible time estimate!

latest_release.release_notes: Updated for compatibility with Pebble Time firmware on Aplite.

data.title: Local Sidereal Time Watchface

A first playing around face, inspired by Unix interfacing. It is quite like the other you will find around here, named Terminal etc.
Oh, and yes, I am aware the unix commands shown are not valid, but at least they have something to do with the stuff they show :-)
At the moment, it will show time, and after shaking, date, battery level and bluetooth status. I might change the way this works in the near future.

In case of questions and/or suggestions, do not hesitate to mail!

Enjoy, Frank

data.description:
This watchface, ACT monitor, will show U the information as below:

No more update!
Please refer to ACT monitor.
ACT monitor ,after version 1.4, go with setting page and option for analog or digit clock face, etc.



1. Date, Time, weather and battery%,
    weather updates every hour.
2. the total steps U taked till now today.
3. the total time of sleep, seating, walking, jogging U taked till now today.
4. the activity and the elapsed time of it U take right now.
5. buzz U every 60min for seating and 15min for jogging, no buzz for sleep and walking.
6. "till now today" means from 21:00 lastnight to now, all the data will become zero at 21:00 everyday.

Some code to deal with Accelerometer Data is obtained from open source of GITHUB.
data.title: ACT monitor analog

data.author: Sam Jerichow
data.description:
Summary: symmetric arcs
Readability: hard
Examples: 12:59, 04:36, 06:25, 08:47

Ok, stick with me guys - this is a tough one. In order to read the time, you have to find the clockwise end of the arcs. Those ends represent a number position in an analog watch display. The inner circle shows the hour, the middle circle shows ten minute increments and the outer circle shows the remaining single minutes. So it's a radial digital 12-5-9 watch. The opposite end of the arcs is just for decoration. The symmetry is making the watchface look (super) cryptic but also gives it a futuristic sci-fi look. When the 12th or 6th hour ought to be shown, or if a minute is 0 or 6, the arc is so small, is becomes a dot. 

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2014, 2015 Sam Jerichow
data.title: ION

data.author: Turner Yey

data.author: Sam Jerichow

changelog.release_notes: Neon IO is now available for the Pebble Time Round! It stays compatible with your buddies, the classical Pebble and the Pebble Time. Enjoy!

data.description:
Summary: Neon tubes ftw.
Readability: medium
Examples: 04:36, 12:59, 18:25, 20:47

Neon IO uses an inside-out array for the four digits instead of a 2x2 one. So you have to read the small inner number first and the move outwards digit by digit. 

The most numbers are recognized intuitively - they look like the well known 7-segment digits without the center segment. For the 8 another encryption had to be found, to distinguish it from the 0. The = symbol it is. If it helps, it's like the 8 but just using the two voids (:) that have been stretched (=). The display of the Neon IO looks way more cryptic than the one from Neon. It takes a bit longer to understand it, but the dense mazy style looks cool.

Design / Programming / Copyright © 2012, 2015 Sam Jerichow

latest_release.release_notes: Neon IO is now available for the Pebble Time Round! It stays compatible with your buddies, the classical Pebble and the Pebble Time. Enjoy!

data.description:
Hourly forecast is a watch face designed for daylong outdoor activities like Randonneuring!

Features:
-Shows temperatures, conditions, wind speeds and directions in coming 6 hours.
-Moon phrase display for your night walk.
-Current temperature, wind speed and gust wind info, and condition.
-Current location and updated time.
-Cached data for 36hrs, no need to wait for loading every time!
-Manually choose your location.
-Black or white colour schemes!

Thanks for:
https://github.com/erikflowers/weather-icons for nice icon!

https://github.com/cynorg/PebbleTimely for nice example how to create an informative watch face!

TTF editor for icon font: 
https://icomoon.io

GIF editor for screenshots:
http://gifmaker.me/

http://openfontlibrary.org/en/font/hanken
for nice Hanken Book font!

Refreshed the display for readability.
Added support for Timeline Quick View.
Added support for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2.
Added bluetooth indicator.
Enabled Aplite support.
Adjusted layout for the Pebble Time Round.
Added a battery indicator.
Support for round watches.
Bugfix for location services on Android.
First public release.

data.description:
That bit around the outside is a 24 hour dial that shows the position of the sun and the horizon line. It uses location services and the power of maths to adjust the horizon and solar noon angle for your current location.

Version 2 brings a cleaner and more readable display, along with support for Timeline Quick View, the Pebble 2 and the Pebble Time 2.

latest_release.release_notes:

Added support for Timeline Quick View.
Added support for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2.

data.description:
This is a paid watch-face. You can purchase this face individually for $0.99 or purchase our entire collection of 20+ faces for $5.99. You can purchase within the settings page.

Text Time brings a elegent and stylish text based watch face to your Pebble watch. Every minute that changes brings smooth sliding animations that make for a professional looking face. Change the background color, the text color, and the accent color. Save your phone's battery by choosing fixed location for the weather temperature.

Top Features:
- Sliding animations every minute
- Supports English, Spanish, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Danish and Swedish
- Fixed location weather (No smartphone GPS required)
- Change the background color, main color, and accent color

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed weather and settings not working

data.title: Text Time
